comments.message: Hi Frank, interesting post! Any chance you could find an image to go along with it? Images help grab attention and tell a story with higher impact. We know occasionally people have issues uploading images so let us know by hitting the Feedback button at the bottom of most pages of our site if you face any problems. And here's some tips on adding visual goodness to your idea: http://ideo.pn/vis-uals plus more on evolving your thought-starter: http://ideo.pn/oi-evolve

It's a good idea Frank, I like it. It would suit temporary hospitals perfect. The only issue I can see would possibly be the limitation of movement due to hoses but it might be countered if the hoses are suspended from the ceiling and could be removed and reattached at different areas, possibly one beside each bed.  (Hoses stem from a single refrigeration unit )

description: Apparatus consisting of means to filter the incoming air by hepa filtration; means to pressurize air using a low pressure air pump; means to regulate pressure to  to insure that the pressure cannot become too high; means to split the air flow into two streams; means to chill the first stream of air by means of a ordinary kitchen refrigerator or a bucket of ice; means to remove water condensation from the chilled first air stream; means to control the flow of a second stream of air which is not chilled; and means to combine the chilled and unchilled airflow; means to measure the temperature of the combined stream of partly chilled air; means to control the proportions of air from the first air stream and the second air stream  in order to adjust the temperature of the air entering the bunny suit without changing the pressure of the resulting airstream; means for the assisting staff to adjust the temperature setpoint of the combined chilled air stream to provide maximum comfort for the person wearing the PPE.  The second stream of airflow can be passed through a countercurrent heat exchanger to chill it, remove the condensed water, then reheat it to nearer ambient temperature.  The result will be delivery of filtered  air which is chilled to the desired temperature and is not saturated with water vapor, thus reducing the likelihood that the inside of the transparent mask will fog up.  This apparatus will be very inexpensive because it relies on a locally available refrigerator for chilling.  All the apparatus except the umbilical hose will be outside the controlled environment.  In addition, a second pump and pressure control may be added to maintain the pressure inside the controlled environment slightly below ambient pressure. This will reduce the likelhood that contamination will be spread through gaps in the enclosure.  The pumping apparatus will be outside the controlled environment.  A hepa filter to filter the air removed from the controlled environment will be installed at the end of hose which is inserted through a port in the wall.  When it is to be changed, the hose segment leading to the controlled environment will be detached from the pump and withdrawn into the environment, and then disposed of with the other contaminated materials inside. A new hose with filter at the distal end will then be inserted through the port and into the controlled environment.
summary: Use an ordinary kitchen refrigerator or a bucket of ice  to chill the air which will be then filtered by a hepa filter and sent to the suit.  This keeps the apparatus for filtering, pumping, and chilling the air outside the patient treatment area, and reduces the cost of the suit and its supporting apparatus as low as possible.  One cooing apparatus might supply multiple positive pressure bunny suits and also permit a "hot swap" of source air to a battery powered unit carried by the suited up person to facilitate movement of medical personnel.
title: For a cooled PPE, keep it simple: use a bucket of ice or an ordinary refrigerator to chill the air introduced into the suit.
